meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by absolutism.
meanings.sent1: Her absolutistic views left no room for compromise.
meanings.sent2: The absolutistic ruler demanded complete obedience from his subjects.
meanings.sent3: The absolutistic cat insisted on having its food served at the exact same time every day.
meanings.sent4: His absolutistic approach to problem-solving often led to conflicts with his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's absolutistic rules made the classroom environment rigid and unwelcoming.

meanings.sent1: She had an absolutistic belief in the power of positive thinking.
meanings.sent2: The absolutistic nature of his convictions made him unwavering in his decisions.
meanings.sent3: The absolutistic gardener believed that talking to plants made them grow faster.
meanings.sent4: His absolutistic faith in justice never wavered, even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The absolutistic nature of her moral code guided her actions in every situation.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to make absolute or uncompromising judgments.
meanings.sent1: His absolutistic attitude towards punctuality made him arrive everywhere early.
meanings.sent2: The absolutistic critic never gave any movie a perfect score.
meanings.sent3: The absolutistic chef refused to use any ingredient past its expiration date.
meanings.sent4: Her absolutistic nature made her a formidable opponent in debates.
meanings.sent5: The absolutistic nature of his decisions often alienated those around him.
